item.title: When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable
item.description:
When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable

Alex Lawson, Social Security Works & Sarah Badawi, Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC) join Thom. Plus Special Panel Guest - Patty Lovera, Food & Water Watch. The Department of Justice is launching an investigation into the Dole Food company - one of the world's largest processors of fresh produce.

item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.title: A Turning Point for China?
item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Panama Papers Source Cites 'Income Inequality' in Justifying Leak
item.description:
Panama Papers Source Cites 'Income Inequality' in Justifying Leak

The anonymous source behind the leak of the Panama Papers said that "income inequality is one of the defining issues of our time," and cited the need for governments to do more to address the issue.

item.title: Monitor: Satellite Images Show N. Korea Nuclear Test Could Be Near
item.description:
Monitor: Satellite Images Show N. Korea Nuclear Test Could Be Near

A U.S. monitoring group said Friday that North Korea might be preparing to carry out a nuclear test as the communist country holds its first ruling party congress in 36 years. The website 38 North, run by Johns Hopkins University, said satellite images taken over North Korea's nuclear test site show vehicle movement at a command center, where there is often no activity "except during preparations for a test."

item.title: Massive Canadian Wildfire Could Double in Size
item.description:
Massive Canadian Wildfire Could Double in Size

A forest fire that forced the evacuation of tens of thousands from a Canadian community has the potential to double in size and might not be extinguished for a "very long time." Chad Morrison, senior manager of wildfire prevention at the Province of Alberta Agriculture and Forestry Division, said forest fires were continuing to burn out of control in the parched region, and could double in size.

item.title: More Than a Dozen Arrested in Pakistan Honor-killing Case
item.description:
More Than a Dozen Arrested in Pakistan Honor-killing Case

More than a dozen men have been arrested in Pakistan for the death of a teenage girl whose body was found in a burned-out van. The killing in the village of Makol, near Abbottabad, rocked Pakistan when it emerged that about two dozen men had held a council and decided on the murder as a form of honor killing.
